page.title: 11KNUTSFORD'S ITALIAN BUILDING
page.content: On Legh Road there are Italian houses built by Richard Harding Watt.In Victorian times he visited Italy often which is where he got his ideas. His houses have many towers, and the roofs have semi-circular slates that run downwards. He loved birds which is why some of the bricks stick out. He was a very busy man who rushed everything. His first house was on a hill but it fell down because it wasn't planned properly. Other buildings created by Watt include the King's Coffee House, with the Gaskell Memorial Tower. His original plan for the town was more ambitious, but some parts were never built and others fell into decay. Even so, Watt's buildings remain a unique feature of our town.
